content.description:
Start up the shared runnel start with Klingons and head straight up on nice pockets.

Stay left of the orange hole of Uranus.  Climb up to two bolt anchor just below the crest of the top.
content.protection: 7 or 8 lead bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Left side of the big hole.  Shares start with Klingons Circling Uranus.

First route right of the Petrified alcove.

content.description:
Six bolts of climbing on water sculpted pockets and jugs so numerous that the crux is deciding which holds to use. Slightly overhanging for the first three bolts, easing a bit to the chains.

Like the rest of the area, the holds on Spirit World are very sharp (so sharp that if you fell it could slice you up like a pound of bacon).
content.location: Spirit World is located in the middle of the formation that is just to the right of the Watchtower. A dark streak that bottoms out in a small alcove marks the start of this route.

content.description: This climb reminded my partner of the Mediterranean limestone in Malta.  The line will lead you up glorious grey pockets and scoops, runnels and swirly whirls.  Start with a little mini uber-protected roof, pause at a rest ledge, then fire up pinches and pockets to the anchor.
content.location: As you head up to the belay alcove for Orion and Petrified, this route is on your left.  Large orange-edged hueco marks the start.

content.description:
An excellent, long route through interesting (and sharp!) rock. A large dish midway up, just to the right of the line allows for a no-hands rest (and for clowning around).

At the midpoint rap anchors the rock gets a bit steeper, but good holds abound and in only one or two locations do you wish for slightly better feet.
content.protection: Fourteen bolts (the guide says seventeen — I'm pretty sure I would have noticed an additional three bolts but I didn't see 'em). Bolted anchors.
content.location:
The left variation of the lines that start up the tall main face of

The Watch Tower

proper. There is a rectangular, slotted pocket below the first bolt, which can be gripped like a ladder rung. After the fourth bolt, head left (to the left of the bathtub dish in which grass grows).

content.description: Stem up alcove and move right to face above a tree.
Climb a technical dihedral, then continue up the sustained face.
content.location: Find the belay alcove 20 yards left of Afterlife. This is the belay spot for Orion (left route up the face) and Petrified (5.10c route on the route going up the dihedral).

content.description:
Enter the crux after clipping a few bolts. There is an overall sustained nature to the route, however, it becomes gradually easier and more rewarding the higher you climb.

The limestone on this wall is sharp and high-quality.
content.location: Find the belay alcove 20 yards left of Afterlife. This is the belay spot for Orion (left route up the face) and Petrified (5.10c route on the route going up the dihedral).

content.description:
Start up just left of the low spot trough running under the route. Fun runnels lead to a ledge passing couple of bolts (extend the last one to reduce rope drag).

Step up to the main face.  Climb up to the big, orange hole and continue past on the right. and up to the anchor just shy of the top ridge.
content.protection: Around 10 lead bolts and two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Up and right of the Orion alcove.  Right of the adjacent route Vulcan Nerve Pinch which shares the lower bolts.

Left of Free Spirits.

content.description: A great line with interesting runnels near the top.   Start on Afterlife, 10a, and traverse left following the adjacent bolt line.  Location of the crux probably depends on how you do the traverse left from Afterlife.  Low being easier, high being more fun!  Much higher quality movement than Afterlife.
content.location: Start on Afterlife, traverse left at after 2nd? bolt.

content.description:
Three routes, sharing the same four bolts, start off the fun at

The Watchtower

.

Blood Drive

resides as the second tallest and most direct route on it's north/east face. Begin climbing the slab using shallow pockets and "cake battered" feet. Climb straight up the wall passing a mid-station anchor and head for a drain shaped water runnel. Enter the runnel and put your stemming shoes on. Make delicate work of this long, tedious crux and be rewarded with a set of chains.

climb this route to the first anchor for a fun 5.8

A mid-station anchor allows the use of one 50m rope.
content.protection: Fourteen bolts, an intermediate anchor, and a top anchor with chains. A 70m almost makes it to the bottom, but down-climbing is required. The mid-station anchor allows use of a 50m. Climb the route in its entirety, lower than rap from the mid-station anchor.
content.location:
Blood Drive

is the center route up the tallest wall at the

The Soul Asylum

.

climbs.name: Baby Seal
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe, Jeff Baldwin, Darren Knezek, Jennifer Lynn Moore

content.description:
Climb up the steep start on good holds and gain the little rib leading to the nifty runnel above.

Some edging, nice side pulls on the runnel.  Short but sweet on nice rock.

As the DK says, "perfect for a club".  Ha ha.
content.protection:
Bolted.  Well bolted.

Anchor atop route.
content.location:
Starts in the same belay pocket as Spirit World, to the left of that route.

Rappel/lower from route.

content.description:
After Life

is a great route climbing a various array of pockets, pinches, and water runnels. Goss's guide book says "if there's pockets like this in the afterlife, sign me up". While i wouldn't die in an attempt to gain these attributes, this is a still a fun route, a great warm-up, and should not to be missed.
content.location:
After Life

is the first, direct-most route on the

The Watchtower's

second and separate cliff. Its start is easily identified by a small alcove that seems to invite an attempt.
